definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: go, come, walk (MI [[ואָהלך]], [[לך]]; SI [[וילכו]] ; NH [[הִלֵּח]] (rare), Aram. [[הֲלַח]], [[הַח]] (also BAram.), oftener [[הַלֵּיח]] Pa., halaka, Palm. Ithp. [[אתילכא]] Vog:No. 15, 1. 4; As. alâku Dl:w; also Ar. halaka perish)—

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: (629 t.) as if fr. [[ילך]] ([[ולך]]; vid.

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: [[הֲלוֹח]] Pr 13:20 (Kt.; Qr [[הׂלֵח]], cf. De Now); mpl. [[הִלְכוּ]] Je 51:10; usu.

definitions.title: I.
definitions.body: lit.
of persons,

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: go, proceed, move, walk Ge 22:6, Ge 22:8, Ex 17:5, Am 3:3, Zep 1:17 +oft.; of cherubim Ez Eze 10:16 = living creatures Eze 1:9, Eze 1:12, Eze 1:19, Eze 1:20, Eze 1:21, Eze 1:24; opp. to sitting([[ישׁב]]) De 6:7, De 11:19 (both c. [[בַּדֶּרֶח]]); ‖ running ([[רוץ]]) Pr 4:12, Is 40:31, cf. also 2Ch 30:6; distinguished from riding, driving Ge 24:65 (J ; sq. [[בַּשָּׂדֶה לִקְרָאתֵנוּ]]), Ju Jdg 5:10 ([[עַל־הַדֶּרֶח]]), Is 41:3 ([[בְּרַגְלָיו]]), cf. Ec 5:1 (sq. [[אֶל]]), Ec 10:7 (sq. [[עַל־הָאָרֶץ]]); on usage with prep. v. infr.; but a1so ‖[[וַיִּרְכַּב]] 1Ki 13:13, 1Ki 18:45 cf. 2Ki 9:16; [[וַיֵּלֶךְ רׂכֵב הַסּוּס]] v:2Ki 9:18 (sq. [[לִקְרָאתוֹ]]); [[וַתֵּלָךְ]]…[[נְהַג וׇלֵח]] [[וַתָּבאׂ]] 2Ki 4:24 drive and go forward… and she went, and came.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: depart, go away: Ge 18:33 (J), and ´[[י]] departed, Ge 34:17 (P) then we will take our daughter and depart; cf. 1Sa 14:3, 1Sa 15:27, Ex 3:19 (J), Ex 12:28 (P) 2Ki 5:25 +; go, go out (to a specific duty etc.): of Samuel 1Sa 7:16, Barak Ju Jdg 4:8, Jdg 4:8; go out, forth (opp. [[שׁוּב]]) Ru 1:21 +; = go into exile (without modifier) 1Ch 5:41 cf. Je 22:10 ([[הׂלֵךְ]] of one going into exile; opp. death); v. further [[אֲשֶׁר הָֽלְכוּ שָׁם]] Ez Eze 37:21.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: less oft. where Eng. idiom requires or prefers come, (approach, arrive), vb. in Heb. being referred to starting point; mostly c. prep. (on usage c. prep. in gen. v. infr.):—[[לְכָה אֵלַי]] 1Sa 17:44; so in prayer to ´[[י]], [[וּלְכָה לִישֻׁעָ֫תָה לָ֫נוּ]] Ps 80:3; also in Yahweh's exhortations to Isr: Is 55:1 ([[לַמַּיִם]]), v:Is 55:3 ([[אֵלַי]]); come to, arrive at a land ([[ה]]—[[ָ]] loc.) Ge 29:1; come unto ([[אֶל]]) a people Ru 2:11; but cf. esp. (without prep.) Imv. followed by another Imv., etc., v. infr.

definitions.title: 5 f
definitions.body: , & partic. cases like Nu 22:6, Nu 22:11, Nu 22:17, Nu 23:7, Nu 23:7, Is 55:1, Is 55:1 etc., where actual summons to approach the speaker.

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: with modifiers : (I) a. of space traversed: [[אֵת כָּל־הַמִּדְבָּר]] De 1:19 (cf. I. [[אֵת]]

), [[כָּל־הַבִּתְרוֹן]] 2Sa 2:29; esp. c. acc. [[דֶּרֶךְ]] way, Ge 35:3 (E) Nu 20:17(JE) De 1:31, 2Sa 4:7, 1Ki 13:12, 1Ki 13:12, Je 52:7 cf. [[וְלֽא תָשׁוּב בַּדֶּרֶךְ אֲשֶׁר הָלָָכְתָּ]] 1Ki 13:9; [[הׂלֵךְ דֶּרֶךְ]] = traveler Is 35:8; sq. [[אֳרָחוֹת]] Ju Jdg 5:6 (song), ptcp. cstr. [[הׂלְכֵי נְתִיבוֹת]] v:Jdg 5:6 goers of paths (wayfarers); c, acc. [[דֶּרֶךְ]] = journey Pr 7:19; b. c. acc. of time De 2:14, 2Sa 2:32, cf. Jos 5:6, Jos 14:10; also, with combination of ideas of space & time [[דֶּרֶךְ שְׁלשֶׁת יׇמִים]] Ex 3:18 (+ [[בַּמִּדְבָּר]] v. infr.) cf. Ex 5:3, Ex 8:23, Ex 15:22 (all JE), Nu 33:8 (P) 1Ki 19:4. (2) c. prep.: a. sq. [[בְּ]] of space (territory, country, etc.) in which [[בַּמִּדְבָּר]] Ju Jdg 11:16, Jdg 11:18, cf. [[וַיֵּלֶךְ בַּבַּיִת אַחַת הֵנׇּה]] [[וְאַחַת הֵנׇּה]] 2Ki 4:35 and he walked in the house once hither, once thither; esp. + acc. of time or distance (cf. supr.) Jos 5:6, Jos 14:10 (both D) 1Ki 19:4 [[בָּֽעֲרָבָה]] 2Sa 2:29; cf. [[בַּיַּבָּשָׁה]] Ex 14:29 = Ex 15:19 (P ?); [[בְּתוֹךְ הָעֵמֶק]] Jos 8:13 (JE); sq. [[בְּ]] of way, path [[בְּדֶרֶךְ]] 1Ki 18:6, 1Ki 18:6 ´[[בַּדּ]] Nu 21:22 (JE) Jos 24:17 (E) De 1:33, De 2:27, Ju Jdg 18:6, 1Sa 28:22; [[לאׁ תָשׁוּב לָלֶכֶת בַּדֶּרֶךְ]] [[אֲשֶׁר הָלַכְתָּ בָּהּ]] 1Ki 13:17 ([[הָלַךְ]] of both going & coming); so oft. fig., cf. infr.

definitions.title: II. 3
definitions.body: ; walk in the streets [[בִּדְחׂבׂת]] La 4:18, walk by the way ´[[בַּדּ]] (opp. [[יׇשַׁב]] sit) De 6:7, De 11:19; b. sq. [[עַל]], go or walk on (by) [[עַל־יַד הַיְאׂר]] Ex 2:5; [[עַל־הַדֶּרֶךְ]] 1Sa 9:6 (i.e. set out, start, upon cf. Dr); cstr. sq. [[לְ]] Ju Jdg 5:10. (3) go to, unto: a. sq. acc., in general [[בְּכָל־אֲשֶׁר תֵּלֵךְ]] Ge 28:15 (J) whithersoever thou goest Jos 1:7, Jos 1:9 (D), cf. 2Sa 7:9, 2Sa 8:6, 2Sa 8:14 = 1Ch 17:8, 1Ch 18:6, 1Ch 18:13; more definitely, to a land, with or without [[ארץ]] Ju Jdg 1:26, Jdg 21:21, Je 37:12; so fig. Ho 7:11 resort to (acc.) Asshur (‖[[קרא]]); to a city 1Sa 11:14, 1Sa 11:15, 1Sa 23:5, 1Ki 2:8, 1Ki 11:24, 1Ki 12:1, 1Ki 14:2, 1Ki 14:4, 2Ki 9:1, 1Ch 11:4, 2Ch 8:3, Ezr 8:31; to a house [[בַּיִת]] 2Sa 13:7, 2Sa 13:8, house of ´[[י]] Ps 122:1; a field, Ge 27:5 (J; + Inf. of purpose); valley of salt 2Ch 25:11. b. sq. [[ה]]—[[ָ]] loc., [[אַ֫רְחָה]] Ge 11:31, Ge 12:5, [[פַּדֶּ֫נׇת אֲרָם]] Ge 28:2, Ge 28:5, Ge 28:7 (all P) cf. Ge 29:1 (E) Nu 32:39 (JE) 2Sa 14:23; of city Ge 18:22, Ge 28:10 (both J) Ju Jdg 9:1, 1Sa 15:34, 1Sa 16:13, 1Sa 19:22, 2Sa 15:9, 1Ki 3:4, 1Ki 18:45, 2Ch 10:1; of river Euphrates Je 13:4, Je 13:6, Je 13:7; of a wood 1Sa 23:16; a mountain Jos 2:16 (JE); cf. also [[אָ֫נׇה הָֽלְכוּ]] whither have they gone Ge 16:8, Ge 32:18, Jos 2:5 (all JE) cf. Ne 2:16, Ct So 6:1, Ju Jdg 19:17, [[אָ֫נֶה וׇאָ֫נׇה]] 1Ki 2:42 (but also ´[[אָן ה]] 1Sa 10:14); [[שָׁ֫מָּה]] Je 40:4 but also [[שָׁם]] 1Sa 9:6, Je 45:5; [[הֵ֫נׇּה]] 2Ki 4:35. g. c. prep.: (a) most often sq. [[אֶל־]] unto,, e.g., unto the place, [[הַמָּקוֹם]], Ge 22:3 (E) Ge 30:25 (J), etc.; of land Ge 22:2 (E) Ge 24:4, Ge 24:10 (J) Ge 36:6 (P) Jos 22:9 (D), etc.; of city Ge 22:19 (E) 1Sa 9:10, Jon 3:3, etc.; of house Ge 24:38 (J) Ec 7:2, Ec 7:2; house of God Ec 4:17; of people Ex 19:10 (E) etc.; in other designations of place, Jos 8:9 (JE), Ezr 10:6, Ru 2:9, .etc., also sq. [[אֶל]] = against, of military expedition: Ju Jdg 1:10 against Canaanites; a city Ju Jdg 9:1, 1Ki 22:15 = 2Ch 18:5, 2Ch 18:14; also sq. [[אֶל]] of individual persons Ge 26:1, Ge 26:26 (both J), Ge 41:55 (E) 2Ki 6:22, 2Ki 6:23, 2Ki 22:14 = 2Ch 34:22, Je 41:14 +; once with implic. coire cum femina Am 2:7 (cf. [[בּוֹא]]

definitions.title: 1 e,
definitions.body: p. 98); vid. esp. [[לֵהֲלֽךְ אֶל־אֵל בַּמִּשְׁפָּט]] Job 34:23 of judicial inquiry by God; come unto the speaker Nu 22:16, Nu 22:37 ( both JE), unto the one addressed Is 60:14. (b) rarely sq. [[עַל־]] unto (Je K Ez) c. [[בַּיִת]] 1Ki 20:43, [[שָׂדֶה]] 1Ki 2:26 (+ acc. loc.), cf. [[עַל־כָּל אֲשֶׂר]] Je 1:7, [[עַל־אֲשֶׁר יִהְיֶה שָׁם]] Ez Eze 1:12 (of the [[רוּחַ]]; cf. [[אֶל־אֲשֶׁר]] [[יִהְיֶה שָׁ֫מָּה]] v:Eze 1:20); also [[וַאֲנִיִ הוֹלֵךְ עַלֽ אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִי הוֹלֵךְ]] 2Sa 15:20 = I am going I know not where cf. Lag:Psalt. Hieron. 1874, 156 f. Dr:Sm; v. further Je 3:6 (sq. both [[עַל]] & [[אֶל]]; on confusion of [[אֶל]] and [[לְַ]] vid. these words); sq. [[עַל]] against city 1Ki 22:6, king 2Ch 22:5. (c) sq. [[עַד]] as far as, unto, place [[עַד־כּׂה]] Ge 22:5 (E), cf. 1Ki 12:30 ([[וַיֵּלְכוּ]] [[הָעָם לִפְנֵי הָאֶחָד עַד דָָּן]]), 2Ki 6:2, 2Ki 10:25, 2Ki 7:15 cf. 2Ch 26:8; persons 1Sa 9:9. (d) sq. [[לְ]], to a land 1Ki 10:13 etc.; a city 2Ch 8:17; a mountain 1Ch 4:42; a bamah 2Ch 1:3; cf. [[לִמְבוֹא גְדׂר]] 1Ch 4:39 & v. infr.; also before n.pr. of pers. Ge 24:56 (J); further [[לַמִּלְחָמָה]] Ez Eze 7:14; [[לְסִבְלֽתיכֶם]] Ex 5:4 (J) go to your burdens cf. Is 60:3, [[וְהַתּוֹדָה הַשֵׁנִית הַהוֹלֶכֶת לְמוֹאל]] Ne 12:38 the second thanksgiving choir, that went the opposite way; frequently [[לְדַרְכּוֹ]] etc., go (to, on) one's way Ge 19:2 (J) Ge 32:2 (E) Nu 24:25, Jos 2:16 (both JE) Ju Jdg 18:26, 1Sa 1:18, 1Sa 26:25 +; [[לְמַסָּעָיו]] Ge 13:3 (J); cf. [[הַהוֹלֵךְ לְמֶרְחֲבֵי־אֶדֶץ]] Hb Hab 1:6 that marcheth through the breath of the land (of invader); note esp. in sense of depart to, go away to, almost = return to; [[וְהָלַכְתָּ לְאׂהָלָיךָ]] De 16:7 and thou shalt go (back) to thy tents, so Ju Jdg 19:6, Jdg 20:8, 1Ki 8:66, 1Ki 12:16 = 2Ch 10:16; [[לְבֵיתוֹ]] 1Sa 10:26 cf. 1Sa 14:8, 1Sa 23:18, 1Ki 14:12, 1Ch 16:43; [[לִמְקוֹמוֹ]] 1Sa 2:20 (cf.VB Dr) 1Sa 14:46; v. also go away or off to 1Ch 4:42, 2Ch 8:17. (e) sq. [[בְּ]] into [[בַּשָּׂדֶה]] Nu 22:23 (of Balsam's ass); esp. in [[בּשְּׁבִי]] ´[[ה]] go into captivity Am 9:4, Na 3:10, De 28:41, Je 20:6, Je 22:22, Je 30:16, La 1:18 (= [[שְׁבִי]] ´[[ה]] v:La 1:5) cf. Ez Eze 30:17, Eze 30:18, Is 46:2, Is 48:11 [[בַּגּוֹלָה]]´[[ה]] Je 48:11, Ez Eze 25:3; v. also [[בַּכְּלִמָּה]] ´[[ה]] Is 45:16; [[בַּמִּלְתָמָה]] ´[[ה]] 1Sa 17:13; [[בַּקְּרָָב]] ´[[ה]] 2Sa 17:11 (but v. Dr). (4) go from, depart from, sq. [[מִן]], e.g. 1Ki 2:41, etc., [[מִשָּׁם]] Ge 42:26 (E) 1Ki 19:19; cf. [[אָנׇה אֵלֵךְ מֵרוּחֶָךָ]] Ps 139:7; note esp. [[הָלַךְ מֵעֵינׇיו]] ´[[וּמַלְאַךְ י]] Ju Jdg 6:21 cf. 1Sa 14:17 ([[מֵעִמָנוּ]]), Ho 9:6 ([[מִשּׁׂד]], from destruction; also sq. [[מֵאֵת]] of divorced woman Je 3:l ([[מֵאִתּוֹ]]), cf. also Ge 26:31 (J), Jos 22:9 (? P) [[מֵאֵחֶל]] 1Ki 20:36. (5) c. prep. denoting other relations:—a. [[אֵת]] of accompaniment, [[אִתִּי]] ´[[ה]] (on warlike expedition) Ge 14:24 cf. 2Sa 15:11, Jos 10:24, Ju Jdg 1:3 (sq. [[בְּ]] into), Jdg 7:4, Jdg 7:4, v. also 1Sa 23:23, 2Sa 16:17 +. b. [[עִם]] Ju Jdg 4:8, Jdg 4:8, Jdg 4:9, Jdg 4:9, Jdg 7:4, Jdg 11:8, 1Sa 30:22, 1Sa 30:22, 2Sa 19:26, Nu 22:13, Nu 22:14 (JE) +. g. [[בְּ]] with (cf. [[בְּ]]

definitions.title: III. 1,
definitions.body: p. 89), esp. Ex 10:9, cf. Ho 5:6 ´[[בְּחאׁנׇם וּבִבְּקָרָם יֵלְכוּ לְבַקֵּשׁ אֶת־י]], of vain sacrifices; 2Ch 30:6 the runners went with ([[בְּ]]) letters. d [[בְּקֶרֶב]] in the midst of, Ex 34:9 (JE). e. [[לִפְנֵי]] in front of, before, before Cyrus Is 45:2, (cf. of fire & pestilence, infr.

); of ´[[י]] going before Isr. Ex 13:21, Nu 14:14, cf. also Ex 23:23, Ex 32:34 & (in mng.) Ex 33:14 ([[פָּנַי יֵלֵָכוּ]]), v:Ex 33:15, Is 52:12, with which camp. [[לְפָנֶיךָ חִדְקֶָךָ]] ´[[וה]] Is 58:8; of other gods Ex 32:1, Ex 32:23 (all JE); [[לְנֶגְדֶָּךָ]] Ge 33:12 (J). v. c. [[אַחַר]] go after, follow, persons Ge 37:17 (J) 2Ki 7:15; [[אַחֲרֵי]] Ge 24:5, Ge 24:8, Ge 24:39, Ge 24:61 (all J), Jos 3:3 (D), Nu 16:25 (JE) +; cf. also

definitions.title: II. 3 d
definitions.body: (going after false gods, etc.); [[מֵאַחֲרֵיהֶם]] Ex 14:19 (J). h. [[לְ]] with sense of dativ. ethic.: [[וַיֵּלֶךְ לוֹ אֶל־אַרְחוֹ]] Ex 18:27 (E) and he gat him (betook himself) to his country; [[אֵ֫לֶךְ לִי אֶל]] Ct So 4:6 I will get me unto; [[וְנֵלְכָה־לָנוּ]] 1Sa 26:11 and let us be gone, cf. v:1Sa 26:12, Ct So 2:11 (of rain cf. infr,

); Imv. in same construction: [[לֶח־לְךָ אֶל]] Ge 22:2 (E) get thee unto, [[לְכוּ לָכֶם לְאָהֳלֵיכֶם]] Jos 22:4 (D) also [[לֶח־לְךָ מִן]] Ge 12:1 (J), & [[לְכִי־לָךְ]] Ct So 2:10, So 2:13 get thee away, come away. q adverbial phrases of manner c. prep.: (a) [[בְּ]], [[בְּשָׁלוֹם]] ´[[ה]] go in peace Ge 26:31(J) 1Sa 29:7, 2Sa 3:21, 2Sa 3:22, 2Sa 3:23, 2Sa 15:9; [[בְּכׂהַ הָאֲכִילָה הַהִיא]] ´[[ה]] 1Ki 19:8, [[בְּחֵמָה]] ´[[ה]] 2Ki 5:12 cf. also 1Sa 17:39, Is 52:12; [[בְּסַעֲרוֹת תֵּימָן]] ´[[וְה]] Zec 9:14 of ´[[י]], and he shall go in (or with) storms of the south; [[בְּ]] pretii, [[הַהׂלְכִים בְּנַפְשׁוֹתָם]] 2Sa 23:17 who went at risk of their life (otherwise in ‖ 1Ch 11:19); cf. (b) [[אֶל]], [[אֶל־נַפְשׁוֹ]] ´[[ה]] 1Ki 19:3 he went for his life. (c) [[לְ]], [[לְרַגְלָהּ]] ´[[ה]] 1Sa 25:42 go according to her foot, i.e. follow, attend her; [[לֵךְ לְשָׁלוֹם]] go to, for (in) peace Ex 4:18 (E) Ju Jdg 18:6, 1Sa 1:17, 1Sa 20:13, 1Sa 20:42, 2Ki 5:19; [[וְהׂלְכִים לְתֻמָּם]] 2Sa 15:11. k. with adj. or noun, agreeing with subj. of vb., in acc. (Ges:§ 118.5), sometimes where Lat. & Eng. use an attributive or appositive: walk barefoot 2Sa 15:30; walk naked and barefoot Is 20:3 (c. acc. of duration); ´[[וַתֵּלַכְנׇה נְטֻו֠וֹת גׇּרוֹן רגו]] Is 3:16; cf. 1Ki 8:66; also [[לאׁ תֵלֵךְ רָכִיל בְּעַמֶָּךָ]] Le 19:16 (H) thou shalt not walk as a slanderer among thy people, Je 9:3, [[הוֹלֵךְ רָכִיל]] Pr 11:13, Pr 20:19; and even [[הׂלְכֵי רָכִיל]] Je 6:28 (yet [[רכיל]] poss. abstr., ´[[ר]] ´[[ה]] walk in slander); with adv. accus., construed more generally (Ges:§ 118, 5. c., Ew:§ 279 c); ye shall not walk loftily ([[רוֹמָה]]) Mic 2:3; they shall come bending ([[שְׁחוֹחַ]]) Is 60:14; and Agag came delicately ([[מַעֲרַנּׁת]]) 1Sa 15:82; cf. also Le 26:23 (II.

Also of animals, in similar meanings and combinations: [[הָלַךְ]] Na 2:12 walk about, prowl (lions, fig. of rulers of Assyria); Pr 30:29 (vid. v:Pr 30:30, v:Pr 30:31, of three beasts & a king); walk, go, move ´[[בִּמְסִלָּה אַחַת ה]] 1Sa 6:12 (of cows bringing ark), horses in Zec.'s vision Zec 6:7 [[וַיְבַקְשׁוּ לָלֶכֶת לְהִתְהַלֵךְ]] [[בָּאָרֶץ]]; of beasts & birds Je 9:9, cf. Je 50:3 both man & beast, they are fled, they are gone; of flocks and herbs ([[מִקְנֶה]]) [[יֵלֵח עִמָּנוּ]] Ex 10:26 they shall go with us; [[מֵהר אֶל־גִּבְעָה]] ´[[ה]] Je 50:6 they have gone fr. mt. to hill (Isr. under fig. of wandering sheep); in 1Sa 14:26 rd. prob. [[הָלַךְ]] for [[הֵלֶךְ]] q.v.; esp. in laws of clean & unclean Le 11:20, Le 11:21 every swarming winged thing that goeth on ([[הַהׂלֵחעַל]]) all fours cf. v:Le 11:27, v:Le 11:42; also v:Le 11:27 everything that goeth on its paws, & v:Le 11:42 everything that goeth on (its) belly, (all P), so of serpent Ge 3:14 on thy belly ([[עַל־גְּחׂנְךָ]]) shalt thou go (J), cf. also Je 46:22 [[קוֹלָהּ כַּנׇּחָשׁ יֵלֵח]]; (where appar. rel. cl., her voice like the serpent that moves, i.e. like the rustling sound of a gliding serpent, cf. VB); locusts Jos 2:7 ([[אִישׁ בִּדְרָכָיו]]), v:Jos 2:8 ([[גֶּבֶר בִּמְסִלָּתוֹ]]).

in like manner of inanimate things, as: the ark ([[הֵַתּבָה]]) Ge 7:18 (P; sq. [[עַל־פְּנֵי הַמָָּיִם]]); ships 1Ki 22:49 (sq. [[ה]]—[[ָ]] loc.) = 2Ch 20:36 (sq. acc. of limit), cf. 2Ch 9:21 (sq. acc.) 2Ch 20:37 ([[אֶל]]); of [[אֳנִי־שַׁיִט]] Is 33:21, lsgalley with oarsrs (sq. [[בְּ]] of place in which); wheels (in Ezekiel's vision) Ez Eze 1:17, Eze 1:17, Eze 1:19, Eze 1:21, Eze 10:11, Eze 10:11, Eze 10:11, Eze 10:11; moon Job 31:26; wind Ps 78:39, Ec 1:6, Ec 1:6; of streams ([[הַנְחָלִים]]) = flow [[אֶל־הַיׇּם]] Ec 1:7; cf. [[אֶל־מְקוֹם שֶׁהַנְחָלִים הׂלְכִים]] [[שָׁם הֵם שָׁבִים לָלֶכֶת]] v:Ec 1:7 unto the place whither the streams flow, thither they flow again; also [[אֲפִיקִים]], sq. [[מַיִם]] as accus. of that with wh., Joe 4:18 ‖ of hills flowing [[חָלָב]], with milk; cf. further fig. [[כָּל־בִּרְכַּ יִם תֵּלַכְנׇה מַיִם]] Ez Eze 7:17, Eze 21:12 all knees shall flow down in water, i.e. be as weak as water; [[נְהָרוֹת]] Ez Eze 31:4 (sq. [[סָבִיב]]); [[וְהָלַךְ עַל־כָּל־גְּדוֹתָיו]] Is 8:7 i.e. overflow (‖[[עָלָה עַל־אֲפִיקָיו]]) cf. Jos 4:18 (JE); so of water (as SI:4) Is 8:6, 1Ki 18:35 ([[הַמַּיִם סָבִיב לַמִּזְבֵָּחַוַיֵּלְכוּ]]), Ps 105:41 ([[הָֽלְכוּ בַּחִיּוֹת נׇהָר]], they flowed through dry regions as a river); (on Inf. abs. used of waters of flood, Ge 8:3, Ge 8:5, cf. infr.

definitions.title: 4 c
definitions.body: (4), (5)); of the sea [[הַיָּם הוֹלֵח וְסׂעֵר]] Jon 1:11, Jon 1:13 was going on and being stormy = was growing more and more stormy (cf. infr.

definitions.title: 4 d
definitions.body: ); of wine ([[יַיִו]]) Ct So 7:10 that goeth down, for my beloved, smoothly (smile); also of lighting go, dart ([[בָּרָק]]) Job 38:35, so [[אֵשׁ]] Ex 9:23 (E) [[וַתִּהֲלַח אֵשׁ אָָרְחָה]] and fire darted to earth (on form, here & Ps 73:9 infr., as intens., of rapid motion, cf. Thes Ew:§ 138 b Kö:i. 415); [[אֵשׁ לְפָנׇיו תֵּלֵח]] Ps 97:3; of torches, in fig. of violent breathing of crocodile [[יַהֲלָֽכוּ מִפִּיו לַפִּידִים]] Job 41:11; of sword [[אַחֲרַיִךְ תֵּ֫לֶךְ חָָרֶב]] % Je 48:2, of arrow [[בָּרָק]] Job 20:25 drawn from a wound; of pestilence [[דֶּבֶר]] (personified) Ps 91:6 ([[בָּאׂפֶל]]), Hb Hab 3:5 ([[לְפָנׇיו]]); of fame [[שָׁעְֶוֹ הוֹלֵח בְּכָל־הַמְּדִינוֹת]] Es 9:4; of the tongue (bad sense) [[וּלְשׁוֹנׇם תּהֲלַח בָּאָרֶץ]] Ps 73:9 (cf. Ex 9:23 supr.; ‖[[שַׁתּוּ בַשָׁמַיִם פִּיהֶם]]); of sound of trumpet Ex 19:19 (Pt. cf. infra

definitions.title: 4 d
definitions.body: ); of letters [[אִגְּרוֹת]] Ne 6:17 (sq. [[עַל]], unto); of dew ([[טַל]], ‖[[עֲנַן־בּׂקֶר]]) sim. of Isr.'s [[חסֶד]] Ho 6:4 cf. Ho 13:3 like dew that passeth away; so of [[עָנׇן]] Job 7:9 [[עָנׇן וַיֵּלַָחכָּלָה]]; of rain [[הַגֶּשֶׁם חָלַף הָלַךְ לוֹ]] Ct So 2:11 the rain is over, it hath taken itself away; of ark of ´[[י]] (´[[אֲרוֹן י]] 1Sa 6:8 depart (cf. also

definitions.title: 5 d
definitions.body: ); of shadow on dial go forward 2Ki 20:9 (opp. [[שׁוּב]]; ‖[[נׇטָה]] v:2Ki 20:20 & [[יַרַד]] Is 38:8); grow, of wicked under fig. of tress, [[יֵלְכוּ גַּם־עָשׂוּ פֶָּרִי]] Je 12:2; cf. [[יֵלְכוּ יוֹנְקוֹתָיו]] Ho 14:3 his branches shall spread, said of Isr. under fig. of tree; of name (= fame) 2Ch 26:8 (sq. [[עַד־לְבׂא מִעחרַיִם]]); also of a thing that does not actually move; [[וְהָלַךְ הַגְּבוּל אֶל]] Jos 17:7 and the boundary went unto etc., cf. Jos 16:8 (sq. [[מִן]] & [[ה]]—[[ָ]] loc.);—in 2Ki 13:21 and it (the dead body) went i.e. was let down into the grave, rd. [[וַיֵּלְכוּ]] for [[וַיֵּלֶח]] LXXL Th Klo, and they went away.
The Inf. abs. is often used

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: as in other vbs., quite independently (Ges:§ 113, 1): [[וְהָלֽךְ אַחֲרִי אֱלֽהִים אֲחֵרִים]]… … Je 7:9 (series of 6 Inf. abs.) (are there) stealing, murdering, and adultery and false swearing and incense-burning to the Baal, and going after other gods…? as obj., [[וְלאׁ־אָבוּ בִרְרָכָיו הָלוֹךְ]] Is 42:24 and they desired not walking in his ways; as appos. of obj., Je 23:14 I have seen … an abominable thing, committing adultery and walking in lies ([[נׇאוֹף וְהָלוֹךְ בַּשֶּׁקֶר]]); cf. [[וַיַּעַשׂ כֵּן הָלוֹךְ עָרוֹם וְיׇחֵף]] Is 20:2 and he did so, a walking naked and barefoot, where also two adverb. accus. modifying the Inf. abs. (Ges:§ 113, 2).

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: to intensify meaning of finite form of [[הָלַךְ]] (Ges:§ 118, 3): (1) before finite vb. [[הָלוֹךְ אֵלֵךְ עִמָּךְ]] Ju Jdg 4:9 I will surely go with thee, cf. Je 37:9; [[הָלֽךְ הָלַכְתָּ]] Ge 31:30 concessive, thou art indeed gone, [[הָעֵחִים הָּלוֹךְ חָֽלְכוּ]] Ju Jdg 9:8 introductory, the trees went forth on a time to anoint them a king. (2) after finite vb. [[וַיֵּלֶךְ הָלוֹךְ]] 2Sa 3:24 and he is actually gone! (a grave impurdence to permit it!), ´[[נֵלְכָה הָלוֹךְ לְחַלּוֹת אֶת־פְּנֵי י]] Zec 8:21 let us by all means go to seek the favour of ´[[י]]

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: most noteworthy is the joining of the Inf. abs. (I) with a following Inf. abs. denoting a simulaneous action or process, and so emphasizing duration or continuance: a. both Infs. preceding the finite vb., [[הָלוֹךְ וְטָפׂף תֵּלַכְנׇה]]Is 3:16 a going and atripping they go, i.e. they keep tripping as they go; so [[הָלוֹךְ וּבָכוֹ יֵלֵָכוּ]] Je 50:4 continually weeping they shall go; b. one Inf. before, & one after the fin.vb. [[הָלוֹךְ יֵלֵךְ וּבָבׂה]] Ps 126:6 continually may one go weeping g. elsewhere both after fin. vb. Jos 6:9 the rearguard was going ([[הׂלֵךְ]]) after the ark, continually blowing on the trumpets ([[הָלוֹךְ וְתָקוֹעַ בַּשּׁוֹפָרוֹת]]), cf. v:Jos 6:13 (where [[הָו֠לֽךְ]] cf, infr.; both JE), …[[וַיֵּלֶח]] [[הָלוֹךְ וּבָכוֹ]] 2Sa 3:16, of cows [[הָֽלְכוּ הָלוֹךְ וְגׇעוֹ]] 1Sa 6:12 they went continually lowing, [[וַיֵּלֶךְ הָלוֹךְ וְאׇבׂל]] Ju Jdg 14:9 and he went on, eating as he went; [[הׂלְכִים הָלוֹךְ וְרַבֵּר]] 2Ki 2:11 they were going on, talking as they went; in [[הׂלֵךְ הָלךְ וּבׂכֶה]] Je 41:6, the pt. [[בּׂכֶה]] is peculiar, rd. perh. [[בָּכׂה]], and for [[הׂלֵךְ]] rd. [[הׂלְכִים]] LXX Hi cf. Gf. (2) with a foll. vb. fin. c. [[ו]] consec. (rare): [[הׂלְכִים הָלוֹךְ וְתֽקְעוּ]] Jos 6:13 (JE) they were going along continually blowing on the trumpets; [[וַתַּלֶךְ הָלוֹךְ וְזׇעָָקָה]] 2Sa 13:19 and she went, crying out as she went; [[הָלוֹךְ]]…[[הׂלֵךְ ]] [[וִיְקַלֵּל]] 2Sa 16:13 he went along…cursing as he went; so 1Sa 19:23 and he went on, prophesying as he went, until he came, etc. (3) in cases where vb. fin. is foll. by Inf. abs. + adj. denoting progress, advance: [[וַיּלֶךְ חָלוֹךְ וְקָרֵב]] % 2Sa 18:25 and he came continually nearer (nearer & nearer); elsewh. with idea of actual motion lost fr.vb. fin.: [[וַיֵּלֶךְ הָלוֹךְ וׇרָָב]] 1Sa 14:19 and he tumult kept growing greater and greater; so [[וְגׇדוֹל וַיֵּלֶךְ דָּוִד הָלוֹךְ]] 2Sa 5:10 = 1Ch 11:9; cf. Ju Jdg 4:24 and the hand of the sons of Israel kept growing more and more severe ([[הָלוֹךְ וְקָשָׁה]]…[[וַתֵּלָךְ ]]) upon Jabin; note esp. [[וַיִּגֲּדּל הָאִישׁ וַיֵּלֶךְ הָלוֹךְ וְגׇדֵל עַד־בִּי־]] [[גֶרַל מְאׂד]] Ge 26:13 (J) and the man grew great and kept on growing greater and greater until etc. ([[נָּדֵל]] partic. adj.). (4) twice, where vb. fin. is not [[הלך]], but another vb. denoting motion: [[הָלוֹךְ וׇשׁוֹב]]…[[וַיָּשֻׁבוּ הַמַּיִם ]] Ge 8:3 (J) and he waters retired continually more and more; [[וַיִסַּע אַבְּרָם הָלוֹךְ וְנׇסוֹעַ הַנֶּ֫גְבָּה]] Ge 12:9 (J) and Abram journeyed on continually further toward the south country. (5) quite by itself is Ge 8:5 (P) [[וְהַמַּיִם הָיוּ הָלוֹךְ וְחָסוֹר]] and he waters, they continually diminished (were a going and a diminishin; the Infs. abs. being predicate). (6) 13 t. the Inf. abs. = Imv. & is followed by Pf. consec. (chiefly in Je): [[הָלוֹךְ וְדִבַּרְתָּ֫]] 2Sa 24:12 go and speak, so Je 35:2; [[וְאָמַרְתָּ֫]] ´[[ה]] go and say, Is 38:5, Je 28:13, Je 34:2, Je 35:13, Je 39:16; [[וְקָרָאתָ]] ´[[ה]] Je 2:2, Je 3:12; also [[וְרָחַחְםתָּ֫]] ´[[ה]] 2Ki 5:10 go and wash, [[וְקָנִיתָ]]´[[ה]] Je 13:1, Je 19:1 go and buy, [[וְעָמַדְתָּ֫]] ´[[ה]] Je 17:19 go and stand.

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: akin to the use of Inf. abs. are some instances of Pt. [[הׂלֵךְ]] + adj. (or pt.): [[וַיֵּלֶךְ הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי]] [[הׂלֵךְ וְקָרֵב]] 1Sa 17:41 and the Philistine came continually nearer (cf. 2Sa 18:25 supr.); in other cases as predicate, with same idea of growing, increasing: [[וְדָוִד הׂלֵךְ וְחָזֵק וּבֵית שָׁאוּל הׂלְכִים וְדַלִּים]] 2Sa 3:1 and David was growing stronger and stronger, while the house of Saul were growing weaker and weaker, cf. 2Ch 17:12, Es 9:4 (of individuals), 2Sa 15:12 (of people); + 2 adj. [[וְהַנַּעַד]] [[שְׁמוּאֵל הׂלֵךְ וְגׇדֵל וָטוֹב]] 1Sa 2:26; cf. (with different order) of wind, Ec 1:6 goeth ([[הוֹלֵךְ]])toward the south, and turneth about ([[סוֹבֵב]]) unto the north, the wind turneth about and about continually ([[סוֹבֵב סׂבֵב הוֹלֵךְ הָרוּחַ]]); of sea [[הַיָּם הוֹלֵךְ וְסׂעֵר]]Jon 1:11, Jon 1:13 the sea was growing more and more stormy; also [[וַיְהִי קוֹל הַ שּׁׂפָר חוֹלֵח וְחָזֵק]] [[מְאׂד]] Ex 19:19 and the sound of the trumpet kept growing louder and louder; & in metaph. [[אׂרַח חַדִּיקִים כְּאוֹר נָׁגַהּ הוֹלֵךְ וׇאוֹר עַד־נְכוֹן הַיּוֹם]] Pr 4:18 the pth of just men is like a shining light, growing lighter and lighter until the full day.
In combination with other verbal forms:

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: sq. Inf. of purpose (c. [[לְ]]) Ge 25:22, Ge 31:19, Ge 37:25 (all JE) Nu 14:38 (P) Nu 24:1 (JE), Ju Jdg 8:1, Jdg 9:8, Jdg 9:9, Jdg 9:11, Jdg 9:13 + oft.; esp. [[לִקְרַאת]] ´[[הּ]] go to meet Jos 9:11 (JE), 2Sa 19:16, 1Ki 18:16, 1Ki 18:16 +; sometimes with hostile sense 1Sa 23:28, 1Ki 20:27, 2Ki 23:29; also [[לָּשּׁובּ]] ´[[הּ]] go to return, Ex 4:21 (RV go back), cf. also [[שּׁובּ לָּלֶּכֶּתּ]] return again Ec 1:7, Ec 5:14; [[לָּבּוֹ־]] ´[[הּ]] go to come (enter etc.) Je 41:17 cf. 2Ch 26:8.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: sq. finite vb. go and do so and so: Ge 22:13, Ge 27:14, Ex 2:8, Ex 4:27, Ex 4:29 (all JE), De 13:7, De 13:14, De 17:3, De 24:2, Is 2:3 = Mic 4:2, Je 11:12 + oft.; [[וַיֵּלֶךְ וַּיָשָּׁבּ]] Ex 4:18 (E), [[יֵלֵךְ]] [[וְיָשׁׂב]] De 20:5, De 20:6, De 20:7, De 20:8, no fix (where is there a J or j in it?) Ju Jdg 21:23 cf. Ho 2:9, Ho 5:15; [[וַיׇּבוֹא]] ´[[ה]] went & came Nu 13:26 (P), Ru 2:3, 1Sa 22:5, 2Sa 11:22, 2Ki 4:25; notably [[וַיֵּלֶךְ וַיִּשְׁלַךְ]] 2Ki 3:7 and he went and sent.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: following other verbs: [[וַיׇּקֻמוּ וַיֵּלְכוּ]] Ge 22:19 (E) cf. Ge 24:10 (J) Ge 43:8 (J) Nu 16:25 (JE) Ju Jdg 4:9; [[נִדְעָה סְעָה וְנֵלֵָכָה]] Ge 33:12 (J).

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: esp. as result of action expr. in preced. vb., such as vb. of sending, etc.: [[וַיְשַׁלַּח אֶת־אֶחָיו וַיֵּלֵָכוּ]] Ge 45:24 (E) cf. Jos 1:16 (D) 1Sa 6:8, Job 38:35; also [[יִשׂשּׁאֵהוּ קָדִים]] [[וְיֵלַָךְ]] Job 27:21 an east wind shall carry him off, and he shall depart; [[וַתְ גׇֽרֲושׁהוּ וַיֵּלַָךְ]] Ps 34:1 (title). (Cf. depart also of inanimate things
supr.)

definitions.title: e.
definitions.body: in longer series: [[וַיֵּלֶךְ וִיִּבְרַח וַיִּמָּלֵט]] 1Sa 19:12; [[וַיֵּשֶׁב]]…[[וַיִּסַּע וַיֵּלֶךְ וַיָשָׁב]] 2Ki 19:36 = Is 37:37; cf. Nu 24:25 (JE); [[וַיָּקָם וַיֵּלֶךְ וַיָּבאׁ]] Ju Jdg 19:10; also [[וַיׇּקָם]] [[וַיָּבאׂ וַיֵּלֶךְ]] 2Ki 10:12.

definitions.title: f.
definitions.body: oft; in Imv. foll by 2nd Imv. or equiv., (1) [[לֵךְ קַח־לִי]] Ge 27:13 (J) go, bring me (them), cf. Ho 1:2; [[לְכוּ רְעוּ]] Ge 29:7 (J) go, feed (them), cf. Ge 37:14, Ge 42:19, Ex 4:19 + (in all c. 57 t.; only JED in Hex); but also (2) weakened to mere introductory word (as also supr. passim: esp. 2Ki 3:7 etc.), go to, or come, do (let us do) so & so; [[לְכָה נִכְרְתָה בְרִית]] Ge 31:44 come, let us make a compact, cf. [[נַשְׁקֶה לְכָה]] Ge 19:32 (where subj. fem.); [[לְכוּ וְנֵלְכָה]] 1Sa 9:9 come, and let us go, so v:1Sa 9:10, 1Sa 11:14, Is 2:3 = Mic 4:2, cf. Zec 6:7 +; even [[לֵךְ בּאׁ וְאֶשְׁלְחָה]] 2Ki 5:5 go to, come, and let me send, cf. Is 22:15, Is 26:20, Ez Eze 3:4, Eze 3:11; further Ju Jdg 19:11, Jdg 19:13, 1Sa 9:5, 1Ki 1:12, Ps 34:5 + (in all c. 49 t.; only JE in Hex). (3) apparently intermediate, and shewing transition fr. (1) to (2) are: [[לָח־רֵד]] Ex 19:24, Ex 32:7 cf. Ju Jdg 18:2; [[לְכוּ סֻרוּ]] [[רְדוּ]] 1Sa 15:6; [[לֵךְ עֲלֵה מִוֶּךְ]] Ex 33:1; [[לְכוּ וְהִתְהלְּכוּ]] [[בָּאָרֶץ]] Jos 18:8 & [[לְכוּ בּאׂוּ אַרְחָה]] Ge 47:17 cf. 1Sa 22:5, 1Ki 1:13, 2Ki 7:9; v. further [[לֵכְנׇה שׁׂבְנׇה]] Ru 1:8 & [[שׁׂבְנׇה לֵכְןָ]] v:Ru 1:12; also 2Sa 3:16, 1Ki 19:15, 1Ki 19:20 + (in all c. 36 t.)

definitions.title: Def
definitions.body: II. Fig.; the most common uses follow; in most the origin in a literal meaning is evident: †

pass away, die; in phrases denoting or implying death (cf. Ar. halaka perish); [[וְהִנֵּה אָנׁכִּי הוֹלֵךְ הַיּוֹם בְּדֶרֶךְ בָּל־הָאָרֶץ]] Jos 23:14 (D) lo, I am going to-day the way of all the eath cf. 1Ki 2:2; perh. also Ge 15:2 (JE) I pass away childless, but possibly sub

infr.; also 2Sa 12:23 I am going ([[אֲנִי הׂלֵךְ]]) to him 2Sa 12:23; so of mankind [[דּוֹרהׂלֵךְ וְרוֹר בָּא]] Ec 1:4; more explicitly, [[הַּכּׂל הוֹלֵךְ אֶל־מָקוֹםָ אֶחָָד הַכּׂל הָיֶה]] [[מִן הֶעָפָר וְהַכּׂל שָׁב אֶל־הֶעָפָר]] Ec 3:20 cf. Ec 6:6; also [[בִּשְׁאוֹל אֲשֶׁר אַתָּה הׂלֵךְ שָָׁמָּה]] Ec 9:10, & [[הׂלֵךְ הָאָדָם]] [[אֶל־בֵּית עוֹלָמוֹ]] Ec 12:5; cf. [[בְּמֶרֶם אֵלֵךְ וְאֵינֶנִּי]] Ps 39:14 before I depart and be not; so acc. to some 2Ch 21:20 but cf. infr.

definitions.title: 3 a
definitions.body: (2); once with weaker sense sq. inf., [[חִנֵּה אָנׁכִי הוֹלֵךְ לָמוּת]] Ge 25:32 (J).
live (‘walk’), in general (cf.

definitions.title: Pi. Hithp.
definitions.body: ) (usu. poet., with modifying words): [[כִּי־אֵלֵךְ בְּנֵיא]] [[חַלְמָוֶת]] Ps 23:4 though I walk in a valley of deep darkness; cf. Ps 138:7 & [[אֵ֫לֶחהשֶׁךְ]] Job 29:8; [[קׂדֵר אֵלֵךְ]]Ps 42:10; [[חֲשֵׁבִים]]´[[ה]] Is 50:10, v. also Ez Eze 3:14; perh. also Ge 15:2 cf.
supr.; [[יֵלְכוּ מֵחַיִל אֶל־חָָיִל]] Ps 84:8 they go from strength to strength; [[הוֹלֵךְ בַּתּׂם]] [[יֵלָךְ בֶּטַח]] Pr 10:9; esp.
of moral and religious life; [[יְיַשֶּׁר־לָָכֶת]] Pr 15:21 he maketh straight to walk (waleth straight, upright); partic.

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: walk in ([[בְּ]]) ways (counsels, statutes, etc.), (1) in good sense: (a) [[בְּרֶרֶךְ תָּמִים]] ´[[ה]] Ps 101:6, cf. Is 30:21, Je 6:16, 1Ki 8:36 = 2Ch 6:27; (b) in ([[בְּ]]) ways of ´[[י]] esp. D: De 8:6 (‖[[לְיִרְאָה אׂתוֹ]]) cf. De 10:12, De 11:22 (‖´[[לְאַהֲבָה אֶת־י]] etc.), De 28:9 (‖´[[שָׁמַרמִחְוֹתי]]); v. also De 13:15 +; 1Ki 11:33 (sq. [[לַעֲשׂוֹת]]), v:1Ki 11:38 (sq. [[וְעָשִׂיתָ]]) 2Ki 21:22, Ps 119:3, Ps 128:1; [[בְּאׂרְחׂתָיו]] Is 2:3 = Mic 4:2; further (sq. [[דֶּרֶךְ]]) Ju Jdg 2:17; (g) † in commandments of ´[[י]] 2Ch 17:4; (d) in his law)s) ([[תּוֹרָה]]) Ex 16:4, Ex 16:14 (J) 2Ki 10:31, Je 9:12, Je 44:23 (+ [[בְּתֻקּׂת]] & [[בְּעֵדְוֹת]]), 2Ch 6:16, Da 9:10, cf. Ne 10:30 (of [[אֱלֽהִים]]); (e) † in his ordinances, statutes ([[חֻקּוֹת]]) Le 26:3, 1Ki 6:12, Je 44:10, Je 44:23 (v. supr.), Ez Eze 5:6, Eze 5:7, Eze 11:20, Eze 18:9, Eze 18:17, Eze 20:13, Eze 20:16, Eze 20:19, Eze 20:21, cf. [[בְּחֻקּוֹת חַיִּים]] Eze 33:15; also [[בְּחֻקֵּי]] 1Ki 8:61, Ez Eze 11:12, Eze 36:27; (z) † in his judgments ([[מִשְׁפָּטִים]]) Ps 89:31, Ez Eze 37:24; (h) ordinances of David 1Ki 3:3, cf. also infr.; (f) in way(s) of good man 1Sa 8:3, 1Sa 8:5, 2Ch 21:12, of David 2Ch 11:17, 2Ch 34:2, of David & So 17:3. (2) in bad sense, (a) in (evil) ways c. [[בְּ]] 2Ki 21:21, Ez Eze 16:47, Eze 23:31, 2Ch 22:3; cf. also (prob.) 2Ch 21:20 [[וַיֵּלֶךְ בְּלאׂ]] [[חֶמְדָּה]] and he lived undesirably (cf. LXX Vulgate Kmp Öt); > others he departed (died) unregretted, so AV RV; (b) sq. acc. 2Ki 21:21, Je 18:15 ([[נְתִיבוֹת]] ´[[ה]]); (g) c. adverb. acc. [[הּוֹלֵךְ עִקְּשׁוּת פֶּה]] Pr 6:12 one walking in perversity (falseness) of mouth (cf. [[חְדָקוֹת]] Is 33:15); (d) in ([[בְּ]])ordinances, statutes ([[חֻקּוֹת]]) of bad men Le 18:3, Le 20:23 (both H) 2Ki 17:8, 2Ki 17:19, Ez Eze 20:18 ([[בְּחוּקֵּי]]).

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: walk with ([[אֶת]], [[עִם]]) i.e. associate, be familiar with: [[בְּשָׁלוֹם]] [[אִתִּי]] ´[[וּבְמִישׁוֹר ה]] Mal 2:6 in peace and uprightness he walked with me (´[[י]]); [[הַחְנֵעַ לֶכֶת עִס־אֱלֽהֶיךָ]] Mic 6:8; but also of people at variance with ´[[י]] [[וַהֲלְכְתֶּם עִמִּי קֶָרִי]] Le 26:23 cf. v:Le 26:27, v:Le 26:40; & of ´[[י]] at variance with people [[עִמָּכֶם בְּקֶָרִי]]…[[וְהָלַכְתִּי ]] v:Le 26:24 cf. v:Le 26:28 (all H); with men, [[אֶת־הֲּכָמִים]]Le 13:20; [[עִם אַנְשֵׁי רֶשַׁע]] Job 34:8; cf. walk with ([[עִם]]) vanity Job 31:5.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: walk before ´[[י]] (´[[לִפְנֵי י]]; c. [[בֶּאֱמֶת]], [[בְּכָל־ׂלִבָּם]] etc.) 1Ki 2:4, 1Ki 3:6, 1Ki 8:23, 1Ki 8:25, 1Ki 9:4, 2Ch 6:16, 2Ch 7:17 cf. ´[[קְדׂרַנִּית מִפְּנֵי י]]´[[ה]] Mal 3:14; walk before the living (i.e. walk aright before them) Ec 6:8.

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: walk, go, after ([[אַהֲּדֵי]]) (1) ´[[י]] De 13:5, 1Ki 14:8, Je 2:2, Ho 11:10 +; (2) other gods, Ju Jdg 2:12 esp. D: De 4:3, De 6:14, De 8:19, De 13:3, De 28:14, Je 2:23, Je 7:6, Je 8:2, Je 11:10, Je 16:11, Je 25:6 +; cf. go & serve other gods Jos 23:16, De 13:7, De 13:14, De 17:3, De 29:17 (cf. De 28:14 supr.); (3) things which do not profit Je 2:8; (4) vanity Ho 5:11 (reading [[שָׁוְא]] cf. VB); v. also Am 2:4.

definitions.title: e.
definitions.body: walk in (1) one's integrity, etc., [[בְּתֻמִּי]] Ps 26:11 cf. Ps 84:12, Pr 10:9, v. also [[תָּמִים]] ´[[ה]] Ps 15:2, [[הׂלְכֵי תׂס]] Pr 2:7; (2) bad sense, in ([[בְּ]]) sin 1Ki 15:3, 1Ki 15:26, 1Ki 15:34, 1Ki 16:2, 1Ki 16:26, 2Ki 13:6, 2Ki 13:11 + (esp. of wicked kings); (evil) counsel 2Ch 22:5 cf. Ps 1:1.

definitions.title: f.
definitions.body: (1) [[לֵב]] as subj., (a) = thoughts, [[לאׁ לִבִּי הָלַךְ]] 2Ki 5:26 did not my thoughts go forth; (b) evil inclination, Job 31:7 [[לִבָּם הׂלֵךְ]]…[[אֶל־לֵב שִׁקּוּחֵיהֶם ]] Ez Eze 11:21; sq. [[אַהֲרֵי]] [[גִלּוּלֵיחֶם]] Eze 20:16, [[אַחֲרֵי בִחְעָם]] Eze 33:31; (2) [[נֶפֶשׁ]] = desire, [[טוֹב מַרְאֵה עֵינַיִם מֵהֲלָח־נֶפֶשׁ]] Ec 6:9 better is sight of the eyes than outgoing of desire

other fig. uses: depart from [[מִפֲּנֵי]] Ho 11:2 (from prophets as God's messengers; opp. [[קָרָא]]); go into, [[הָֽלְכוּ בַכְּ לִמָּה]] Is 45:16  they have gone into confusion (judgment on idol-makers); etc. †

definitions.title: Niph.
definitions.body: Pf. 1 s. [[כְּחֵל כִּנְטוֹתוֹ נֶהֱלָָכְּ תִּי]] Ps 109:23 l1 Ke a shadow when it stretches out I am gone (cf. [[היה]]

walk in or with a throng sq. [[בְּ]] loc.: [[נְהַלֵךְ בְּרָָגֶשׁ]] ´[[בְּבֵית א]] Ps 55:15; walk, tread on coals [[עַל־הַגֶּחָלִים]] Pr 6:28; of idols Ps 115:7 they do not walk, have not the power of walking (cf. [[יִחְעָָדוּ]] Je 10:5); of one tramping, formidable, sim. of poverty [[וּבָא־כִמְהַלֵּךְ רֵאשֶָׁךָ]] Pr 6:11, —a highwayman acc. to Ges Ew Hi Now, cf. LXX; ‖[[מַחְסׂרְךָ כְּ אִישׁ מָנֵן]] cf. also Hithp. Pr 24:34); of ´[[י]] walking (in majesty), marching, [[לְַ־כַּנְפֵי רוּחַ]] Ps 104:3 on the wings of the wind; of righteousness, personified, [[חֶדֶק לְפָנׇיו יְהַלֵךְ]] Ps 85:14; of wisdom [[בְּאׂרַה חְדָקָה אֲהַלֵךְ]] Pr 8:20 in the path of righteousness do I walk (stedfastly, unswervingly); of animals, go about, prowl, [[עַל הַר־חִיּוֹן שֶׁח֠שָּׁמֵם]] [[שׁוּעָלִים הִלְּכוּ בָוֹ]] (Qr [[שֶּׁשָּׁמֵם]]) La 5:18, of ships, in (stately) movement Ps 104:26; of springs Ps 104:10 between mountains they go (run, flow); of arrows Hb Hab 3:11  at the light of thine arrows that go (fly, shoot; cf.

also of walking about = living [[הַמְַהַלְּבִים תַּחַת הַשַָּׁמֶשׁ]] Ec 4:15; [[עָרוֹם הִלְּכוּ בְּלִי לְבוּשׁ]] Job 24:10 nacked they keep going about (freq.), without clothing; so of going about as mourner [[קׂדֵר הִלַּכְּתִּי]] Job 30:28, Ps 38:7 (cf.

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Ps 42:10); [[בַּאֲפֵלוֹת נְהַלֵךְ]] Is 59:9 in darkness we walk (of distress); on the other hand [[בְּאוֹר פָּנֶיךָ יְהַלֵּכָוּן]] Ps 89:16 (of blessedness & prosperity).
depart, go entirely away ([[מִן]]) [[מִמְּקוֹם קָדוֹשׁ יְהַלֵָּכוּ]] Ec 8:10 from the holy place they must depart (on text cf. VB; ‖[[וְיִשְׁתַּכְּחוּ בָעִיר]]).

fig. of mode of life, action, etc.: of particular path of one's life [[בְּאׂרַח־זוּאֲהַלֵךְ]] Ps 142:4; specif. in good sense [[וַיְהַלֵּךְ אַָט]] 1Ki 21:27 and he (Ahad) walked softly (as a penitent); oftener c. [[בְּ]] of path in which: [[בִּדְרָכַי יְהַלֵָּכוּ]] Ps 81:14 that in my ways they would walk ! cf. Ps 86:11 ([[בַּאֲמִתֶָּךָ]]), Ez Eze 18:9 ([[בְּחֻקּוֹתַי]]); in bad or doubtful sensse [[וְהַלֵךְ]] [[בְּדַרְכֵי לִבְּךָ וּבְמַרְאֵי עֵינֶי֑ךָ]] Ec 11:9; cf. also [[לאׁ הִלַּכְּתּי]] [[בִּגְדׂלֽת]] Ps 131:1 I do not walk (move, tread) among great things (‖[[וּבְנִפְלָאוֹת מִמֶּנִּי]]; fig. of humility, cf. also v:a). †
lit.

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: traverse, in this direction and that, Ge 13:17 (J; [[בָּאָרֶץ]]) Jos 18:4 (JE), v:Jos 18:8 (id.; ´[[בָּאָרֶץ לְכוּ וְהִתְה]] cf. Job 1:7 = Job 2:2 (both ‖[[שׁוּט]]) Zec 1:10, Zec 1:11; similarly also 1Ch 21:4; of fiery appearance in Ezek.'s vision [[בֵּין הַחַיּוֹת]] ´[[מִתְה]] Ez Eze 1:13; of horses in Zec.'s vision Zec 6:7 ([[בָּאָרֶץ]] ´[[לָלֶכֶת לְהִתְ]]), v:Zec 6:7 (´[[לְכוּ הִתְהַלְּכוּ בָּא]]), v:Zec 6:7; go in different directions [[אִישׁ לְשִׁבְטוֹ]]…[[מִשָּׁם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל ]] ´[[וַיִּתְה]] Ju Jdg 21:24 (‖ [[וַיֵּחְאוּ מִשָּׁם]] etc.); so of lightning flashes as arrows of ´[[י]] Ps 77:18 went hither & thither; of water running off different ways Ps 58:8 (sim. of vanishing of wicked).

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: walk, walk about [[הִתְהַלֵךְ בַּחוּץ עַל־מִשְׁעַנְתּוֹ]] Ex 21:19 (JE) i.e. leaning upon his staff; Pr 6:22 (distinguished fr. [[שָׁבַב]], [[חֵקִיץ]]); 2Sa 11:2 ([[עַל־גַנּ בֵּית הַמֶּלָךְ]]); [[וּבְחֵקֶר תְּהוֹם]] [[הִתְהֵלָָּכְתָּ]] Job 38:16 and in the farthest ground of the deep hast thou walked ? [[בְּתוֹךְ אַבְנֵי־אֵשׁ הִתְהַלָָּכְתָּ]] Ez Eze 28:14; so also of ´[[י]] walking on earth, in anthropomorphic conception [[אֱלֽהִים מִתְהַלֵךְ]] ´[[קוֹל י]] [[בַּגׇּן]] Ge 3:8 (J) the sound of ´[[י]] Elohim walking about in the garden; of God (Ēl) [[וְחוּג שָׁמַיִם מִתְהַלָָּךְ]] Job 22:14 and the vault of heaven he walketh; walk about in front of ([[לִפְנֵי]]) Es 2:11; attend, follow, of retainers [[הַמִּתְהַלְּכִים בְּדַגְלֵי אֲרׂנִי]] 1Sa 25:27; wander, of Israel [[מִגּוֹי אֶלאגּוֹי]] Ps 105:13 = 1Ch 16:20; rove about, of David and his band [[אֲשֶׁר־הִתְהַלֶּח־שָׁם]] 1Sa 30:31; [[וַיִּתְהַלְּכוּ בַּאֲשֶׁר יִתְּהָלָָּכוּ]] 1Sa 23:13 (on this phr. cf. Lag:Psalt. Hleron. 1874, 156 f. Dr:Sm); walk about, prowl, of Jehoiachin under fig. of lion, ´[[נויִתְה]] [[בְּתוֹח־אֲרָיוֹת]] Ez Eze 19:6; cf. also [[וּבָא־מִתְהַלֵךְ רֵישֶָׁךָ]] Pr 24:34 and thy poverty cometh marching (cf.

definitions.title: Pi.
definitions.body: Pr 6:11); glide, flow of wine [[בְּמֵישָׁרִים]] ´[[יִתְה]] Pr 23:31 glideth down smoothly (VB; cf.

definitions.title: Qal 3
definitions.body: Ct So 7:10); note esp. the foll., where emphasis lies not on verb, but on an auxiliary word; these cases form the natural transition to the figurative use:—Ps 12:9 on every side wicked men are walking; [[בְּחֶלֶם יִתְהָלֶּח־אִישׁ]] Ps 39:7 in appearance (semblance, lit. image cf. Che:crit. n.) walketh a man; also [[לָמָּה קׂדֵר אֶתְהַלֵךְ]] Ps 43:2 (cf.

fig. walk about = live; the king before ([[לִפְּנֵי]]) his people 1Sa 12:2, so of Samuel v:1Sa 12:2; of priest 1Sa 2:35 ([[לִפְנֵי מְשִׁיחִי]]); of friendly intercourse with ([[אֶת]]) men 1Sa 25:15; cf. [[בְּרֵעַ כְּאָח־לִי הִתְהַלָָּכְתִּי]] Ps 35:14; of man's relation to God: especially sq. [[לִפְנֵי]], [[לְפָנׇי וֶהְיֵהתָמִים]] ´[[ה]] Ge 17:1 (P) walk before me (live constantly in my presence) and (so) be perfect, cf. Ge 24:40 (J), Ge 48:15 (E); [[לְפָנֶיךָ בֶּאֱמֶת וּבְלֵבָכ שָׁלֵם]] ´[[ה]] 2Ki 20:3 = Is 38:3; as token of divine favour [[יִתְהַלְּכוּ לְפָנַי]] [[עַד־עוֹלָם]] 1Sa 2:30 (v. esp. Dr, on sense here & elsewh.); Ps 116:9 [[בְּאַרְחוֹת הַחַיִּים]] ´[[אֶתְּהַלֵּךְ לִפְנֵ י]], Ps 56:13 ([[בְּאוֹר הַחַיִּים]]); [[בִּשְׁמוֹ]] ´[[יִתְה]] Zec 10:12 they shall walk in his name; c. [[אֶת]], of Enoch and Noah [[אֶת־הָאֱלֽחִים]] ´[[ה]] Ge 5:22, Ge 5:24, Ge 6:9 (denoting intimacy, fellowship: all P); further [[בַּאֲמִתֶָּךָ]] ´[[ה]] Ps 26:3 I have walked in thy faithfulness; [[בְּתֻמּוֹ]] ´[[מִתְה]] [[חַדִּיק]] Pr 20:7 he that walketh justly in his (own) integrity; [[בְּתָם־לְבָבִי בְּקֶרֶב בֵּיתִּי]] ´[[אֶתְה]] Ps 101:2; cf. also Ps 119:45 and let me walk in a large place (untrammelled, undismayed); of the wicked [[מִתְהַלֵּךְ בַּאֲשָׁמָיו]] Ps 68:22 one going on in his guilty deeds; ´[[בַּחֲשֵׁכָה יִתְה]] Ps 82:5 they walk in darkness (‖[[לאׁ יׇֽדְעוּ וְלאׁ יׇבִינוּ]]); of their exposure ´[[עַל־שְׁבָכָה יִתְה]] Job 18:8 he walketh on net-work, (snare, cf. [[שׂבכה]]; ‖[[שֻׁלַּח בְּרֶשֶׁת בְּרַגְלָיו]]); esp. of ´[[י]] as accompanying Israel [[בְּקֶרֶב מַחֲנֶךָ]] ´[[מִתְח]] De 23:15 walk in the midst, etc., [[בְּתוֹכְכֶם]] Le 26:12; 2Sa 7:7 wherever ([[בְּכׂל אֲשֶׁר]]) I have walked with (among [[בְּ]]) all (the sons of) Isr. = 1Ch 17:6; as inhabiting a tent, on the march, [[וָּאֶהְיֶה מִתְהַלֵּךְ]] [[בְּאׂהֶל וּבְמִשְׁכָָּן]] 2Sa 7:6 and I was walking in a tent and in a tabernacle.

definitions.title: Hiph.
definitions.body: Pf. 3 ms. [[הוֹלִיךְ]] (as if from [[ילך]], i.e. a verb [[ו]]“[[פ]], cf. reff. sub
lead, bring: sq. acc. usually of person;

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: c. [[בְּ]] of space or region through which, De 8:15 (Isr. in wilderness) Je 2:6, Ps 136:16, so also Is 48:21; [[בַּדָָּרֶח]] Je 2:17; cf. Jos 24:3 (E), Is 63:13, Ps 106:9; also fig. Is 42:16 and I will lead (the) blind in a way ([[בְּדֶרֶח]]) they know not;

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: c. acc. pers., [[בְּ]] of space + acc. of time [[וׇאוֹלֵח]] [[אֶתְכֶם אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנׇה בַּמִּדְ בָּר]] De 29:4; so Am 2:10 (sq. Inf. of purpose c. [[לְ]]).

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: sq. acc. pers. + acc. of way, road, De 8:2, cf. [[דֶּרֶח הַדָּרוֹם]] Ez Eze 40:24 (acc. of direction).

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: sq. acc. pers. + acc. of place or condition to which …[[אֶת־נְשֵׁי הַמֶּלֶךְ]] [[הוֹלִיךְ גּוֹלָה]] 2Ki 24:15 the women of the king, etc., he led into exile ([[מִירוּשָׁלְם בָבֶָלָה]]); so also, of exile [[וְהוֹלַכְּתִּיהָ הַמִּדְבָּר]] Ho 2:16; [[בָּבֶל]] Je 32:5; cf. of Yahwesh's chastisement, La 3:2 me hath he driven and brought, into darkness and not into light; sq. acc. pers. + [[אל]]:[[אֶל־גוֹי ]] etc. De 28:36 (of exile); [[אֶל־נַחֲלֵי־מַיִם]] Je 31:9; [[אֶל־הַשַּׁעַר]] Ez Eze 43:1; [[אֶל־הָעֵדָה]] Nu 17:11 (P; implic. obj. being censer); [[אֶל]] of pers. 2Ki 6:19, Je 52:26, [[עַל]] in ‖ 2Ki 25:20; [[עַל]] also 1Ki 1:38 [[וַיּׁלִכוּ אׂתוֹ עַל־גִּיחוֹן]] (see sub [[עַל]]

definitions.title: 7 c
definitions.body: b).

lead away sq. acc. pers. + appos.; [[מוֹלִיח יוֹעֲחִים שׁוֹלָָל]] Job 12:17 he (´[[י]]) leadeth away counsellors despoiled cf. v:Job 12:19; of Yahweh's judgment on the wicked Ps 125:5 ´[[י]] will lead them away with ([[אֶת]]) the workers of iniquity.
carry, bring: c. obj. helpless, or inanimate:

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: + acc. loc., Josiah to Jerusalem ([[יְרוּשָׁלַם]]) 2Ch 35:24 ([[וַיְבִיאֻהוּ]] in ‖ 2Ki 23:30); cf. Zec 5:10 whither are these carrying the ephah? [[אָ֫נׇה אוֹלִיח אֶת־חֶרְפָּתִי]] 2Sa 13:13.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: carry, take, take away, [[חֵילִיכִי אֶת־הַיֶּלֶד]] Ex 2:9 (E; on form cf. supr.); also carry away [[בְּתׇדוֹ]], in his hand, Ec 5:14; of the spread of a careless speech Ec 10:20 fowl of the heavens shall carry the voice (‖[[בַּעַל ה֠כְּנׇפַיִם יַגֵּיד דָּבָר]]).
fig., of influence on character: c. acc. pers. + [[בְּ]] into: Pr 16:29 and he will lead him into a way that is not good (i.e. sinful).

definitions.title: 5. a.
definitions.body: cause to walk, go, men (i.e. [[עַמִּי יִשְׂרָאֵל]]) on ([[עַל]]) the mountains of Israel Ez Eze 36:12 (‖[[וִירֵשׁוּךָ]], [[וְהָיִיתָ לָהֶם לְנַחֲלָה]]); cf. [[וׇאוֹלֵח]] [[אֶתְכֶם קוֹמֲמִיּוּת]] Le 26:13 and I caused you to walk upright (fig.; opp. to being bowed down by a yoke); Is 63:12 that caused his glorious arm to go at ([[לְ]]) the right hand of Moses.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: cause to flow, run Ez Eze 32:14 and rivers like oil will I cause to flow.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: cause to depart, retire, go back, ´[[י]], the sea, Ex 14:21 ([[בְּ]] instr., [[בְּרוּחַ קָדִים]]).
